title: Docs: incorporate restored transcripts 205‚Äì235 primitives
description: Extend quote bank with high-signal verbatim snippets from newly restored later transcript sections (e.g., ¬ß205/¬ß206/¬ß210/¬ß215/¬ß216/¬ß218/¬ß221‚Äì¬ß222/¬ß224/¬ß228/¬ß230/¬ß231/¬ß233/¬ß235) and propagate any new primitives into metaprompt + distillation docs.

title: Scaffold web app + CLI for Agent Mail kickoff
description: Create initial Next.js app skeleton and single-file Bun CLI to compose Brenner Loop prompts and send via Agent Mail.

title: EPIC: Brenner Bot Lab v1 (brennerbot.org + bun binary)
description:
# North star
Build a *documents-first* multi-agent "research lab" that operationalizes the **Brenner method** into repeatable workflows.

Deliverables:
1) **Web app** (deployed to Vercel, served at `brennerbot.org`) that feels like a *scientific IDE*: corpus ‚Üí excerpt ‚Üí protocol ‚Üí multi-agent orchestration ‚Üí durable artifacts.
2) **Single executable** (`brenner`, built with `bun build --compile`) that can run the same workflows from the terminal for automation and power users.

This epic is the umbrella roadmap for turning this repo‚Äôs corpus + distillations into a usable system.

---

# Brenner-aligned product principles (the "kernel")
These are the invariants we should protect as we build:

- **Evidence per week (E/W)**: optimize for cheap, decisive questions; don‚Äôt build a cathedral before we‚Äôve found the bite point.
- **Digital handles**: prefer workflows that force discrete outputs (enumerated hypotheses, explicit tests, boolean-ish outcomes) over vibe-y narratives.
- **Operator algebra**: make Brenner‚Äôs moves *UI-visible* (‚äò level-split, ùìõ recode, ‚úÇ exclusion tests, ‚üÇ object transpose, ‚Üë amplify, ‚äû scale check, etc.).
- **Artifacts > chat logs**: sessions must output durable, auditable artifacts (hypothesis slate, discriminative tests, assumption ledger, anomaly register, adversarial critique).
- **Provenance first**: strong bias toward transcript anchors (`¬ßn`) and quotable primitives; syntheses are hypotheses.
- **Tool democratization**: the system should reduce dependence on special infrastructure; local-first workflows should remain viable.

---

# Product shape (what "incredible" looks like)

## Web app (public + private)
- **Public mode**: browse/search corpus + distillations; explore operator palette + tagged quote bank; no orchestration side-effects.
- **Lab mode (gated)**: create sessions, compose kickoffs, orchestrate agents via Agent Mail, compile artifacts, persist results.

## CLI/binary
- Runs the full protocol loop:
  - pick/compose excerpt
  - augment with memory context (optional)
  - send role-specific prompts
  - fetch/parse responses
  - compile artifacts
  - optionally persist to repo

---

# Architecture commitments (to keep us sane)
- **Documents-first**: canonical sources stay as markdown; derived indexes go under a clearly labeled `generated/` directory *with a documented generator command*.
- **Agent Mail is the coordination bus**: web + CLI talk to agents via MCP/Agent Mail; threads are the unit of work.
- **One canonical artifact schema** shared by web + CLI.
- **Security by default**: public site must not expose Agent Mail controls or secrets.

---

# Definition of done (v1)
- `brennerbot.org` serves a polished corpus explorer (fast search + excerpt picker).
- A gated "New Session" flow sends role-specific kickoffs via Agent Mail.
- Session page shows agent responses + compiled artifacts.
- CLI ships as a single binary with `session start|status|fetch|compile`.
- Artifacts conform to a schema and pass a linter (minimum guardrails: third alternative, potency checks, citations).

---

# Risks / open questions
- **Copyright / terms** for transcript redistribution: must verify what can be public.
- **Orchestration security**: Agent Mail endpoints/tokens must never be accessible to arbitrary users.
- **File sprawl vs artifact durability**: we need a disciplined storage layout.

title: EPIC: Brenner Protocol Kernel (operators + artifacts + prompts)
description:
# Goal
Turn the distilled Brenner method into **explicit, enforceable protocols**:
- a canonical artifact schema (what a session must output)
- an operator palette (the "moves" users/agents can invoke)
- role-specific prompt templates (Codex/Opus/Gemini)
- guardrails (third alternative, potency checks, scale prison, exception quarantine)

This is the foundation layer for both the web app and the CLI.

# Why this matters
Without a strict protocol layer, we‚Äôll get "nice essays" instead of **decision procedures**. The protocol kernel is how we make the system produce discrete, mergeable, auditable outputs.

# Outputs
- `Artifact Schema v0.1` (markdown shape + stable IDs + merge rules)
- `Operator Library v0.1` (‚äò ùìõ ‚â° ‚úÇ ‚üÇ ‚Üë ‚áì ŒîE ‚àø ‚äô ‚äï ‚óä ‚Ä† ‚åÇ üîß ‚äû)
- `Role Prompt Pack v0.1` (each role outputs artifact deltas)
- `Guardrail Linter Spec v0.1`

title: Spec: Canonical artifact schema v0.1
description:
# Problem
We need a *single canonical* artifact format that both the web app and CLI can:
- generate
- validate
- render
- merge/update across agents

If the artifact shape is vague, we‚Äôll get non-mergeable prose.

# Proposal (v0.1)
Define a markdown-first schema with:
- required sections
- stable IDs for items (hypotheses, tests, assumptions)
- clear rules for what counts as "a delta" / update

Target artifacts (minimum set):
1) Research thread (stable bite point)
2) Hypothesis slate (2‚Äì5 + third alternative)
3) Predictions table
4) Ranked discriminative tests (with potency checks)
5) Assumption ledger (incl. scale checks)
6) Anomaly register (exception quarantine)
7) Adversarial critique (what would make the framing wrong)

# Acceptance criteria
- A written schema document exists and includes examples.
- A human can hand-author an artifact that conforms.
- A program can validate presence of required sections + IDs.

title: Draft artifact schema doc (sections + stable IDs)
description:
Write the v0.1 artifact schema as a markdown spec:
- required sections
- item ID conventions (H1, T3, A7, etc.)
- examples for each artifact section

Done when: the spec is clear enough that two humans would author the *same* shape.

title: Define artifact delta + merge/update rules
description:
Define how multi-agent outputs update a single artifact without chaos:
- what counts as an "add" vs "edit" vs "kill"
- conflict resolution policy
- ordering rules

Done when: we can write a deterministic merge function against the spec.

title: Create a golden example artifact (one full session)
description:
Create one fully-populated artifact file that demonstrates the schema end-to-end.

Done when: the example includes citations, third alternative, potency checks, ranked tests.

title: Spec: Operator library v0.1 (Brenner moves as primitives)
description:
# Problem
"Brenner style" must be executable. We need an explicit operator palette users can invoke.

# Scope
Operators to include (from distillations):
- ‚äò Level-split
- ùìõ Recode / representation change
- ‚â° Invariant extract
- ‚úÇ Exclusion test / forbidden patterns
- ‚üÇ Object transpose
- ‚Üë Amplify
- ‚áì Democratize tools
- ŒîE Exception quarantine
- ‚àø Dephase / opening-game positioning
- ‚äô Unentrain / productive ignorance
- ‚äï Cross-domain import
- ‚óä Paradox hunt
- ‚Ä† Theory kill
- ‚åÇ Materialize (theory ‚Üí test)
- üîß DIY
- ‚äû Scale check / imprisoned in physics

For each operator:
- definition
- ‚Äúwhen to use‚Äù triggers
- failure modes
- prompt module (agent instructions)
- corpus anchors (`¬ßn`) / quote bank links

# Acceptance criteria
- Operator list + definitions are written and internally consistent.
- Each operator has at least 1 anchored quote in the quote bank.

title: Extract operator definitions + failure modes from distillations
description:
Use the three distillations to write crisp operator definitions and common failure modes.

Done when: each operator has 3 parts: definition, when-to-use triggers, failure modes.

title: Map operators to quote-bank anchors + tags
description:
For each operator, link at least one transcript anchor (`¬ßn`) via `quote_bank_restored_primitives.md`.

Done when: we can navigate from operator ‚Üí supporting quote(s).

title: Write per-operator prompt modules (copy/paste blocks)
description:
Draft reusable prompt snippets for each operator.

Done when: modules are short, imperative, and produce structured deltas.

title: Prompt pack: Role-specific agents output structured deltas
description:
# Goal
Define role prompts for a multi-agent team so outputs are *mergeable*, not essays.

Target roles (initial):
- **Formalizer (Codex/GPT)**: turn narratives into explicit hypotheses/tests + scoring.
- **Architect/Critic (Opus)**: enforce operator algebra + guardrails + conceptual coherence.
- **Novelty/Alt-cluster (Gemini)**: generate "third alternatives" and reframings.

# Key design constraint
Each role must emit:
- a structured artifact delta format (e.g., fenced JSON or strict markdown sections)
- citations to transcript anchors where relevant

# Acceptance criteria
- Prompts are written for each role.
- Each prompt specifies output schema (delta format) and strict sections.
- Prompts explicitly require third alternative + potency checks.

title: Choose and specify the structured delta output format
description:
Decide how agents will express updates:
- strict markdown sections, OR
- fenced JSON (preferred for parsing), OR
- JSON Patch-like operations.

Done when: format is chosen and specified with examples.

title: Write role prompts using the delta format
description:
Write prompts for Codex/Opus/Gemini roles that:
- enforce operator guardrails
- require explicit artifacts + deltas
- cite transcript anchors when claiming "Brenner said"

Done when: each prompt is copy/paste ready.

title: Define evaluation rubric for role outputs
description:
Define what "good" looks like per role:
- structural correctness
- discriminability
- presence of third alternative
- potency checks

Done when: we can score outputs consistently across sessions.

title: Protocol: Agent Mail thread contract (message types + ack semantics)
description:
# Goal
Standardize how sessions use Agent Mail so orchestration is deterministic.

Define:
- thread id conventions (what counts as a session thread)
- message types (kickoff, role response, compile, critique, round-2)
- subject conventions
- required body sections
- ack policy (when required, how to track)

# Acceptance criteria
- A written spec exists for message types + required fields.
- The CLI and web can rely on these conventions.

title: Specify thread + subject conventions
description:
Define conventions for:
- thread IDs (session IDs)
- message subjects (prefixing, role tags)

Done when: a human can look at a mailbox and understand threads instantly.

title: Specify message body schema + ack semantics
description:
Define required message body sections per message type + when ack is required.

Done when: orchestration can be deterministic and machine-checked.

title: Specify artifact publish/compile messages
description:
Define how compiled artifacts are posted back into the thread (and how follow-up rounds reference them).

Done when: the thread has a canonical "latest artifact" pointer.

title: Guardrails: Artifact linter spec (Brenner checks)
description:
# Goal
Define a linter that detects when outputs drift away from Brenner-style decision procedures.

Minimum checks:
- Hypothesis slate size (2‚Äì5) and includes third alternative
- Each proposed experiment includes potency checks (chastity vs impotence)
- Each experiment states which hypotheses it separates
- Assumption ledger includes at least one scale/physics check (‚äû)
- Anomaly register exists (ŒîE) or explicitly states "none"
- Citations: claims labeled as quote-backed vs inference

# Acceptance criteria
- Linter rules are written precisely enough to implement.
- Rules prioritize false-negative tolerance over false positives (don‚Äôt annoy operators).

title: Define linter checks + severity levels
description:
Turn guardrails into a checklist with severities (error/warn/info).

Done when: checks are precise enough to implement.

title: Define citation/provenance rules
description:
Define rules for distinguishing:
- quote-backed claims
- inference/interpretation

Done when: artifacts can be audited.

title: Define what is machine-checkable vs human-review
description:
Identify which guardrails can be enforced automatically and which should be review prompts.

Done when: we avoid building an annoying or brittle linter.

title: EPIC: Corpus Engine (parse/search/quote-bank/excerpts)
description:
# Goal
Make the corpus usable as a *tool*, not just a document:
- fast full-text search across the transcript + distillations
- stable anchors (`¬ßn`) and excerpt composition
- a quote bank tagged by operators/primitives

# Why this matters
The corpus is the "ground truth". If it‚Äôs hard to search, cite, and excerpt, the whole system drifts into ungrounded synthesis.

title: Corpus: transcript section parser + structured index
description:
# Goal
Turn `complete_brenner_transcript.md` into a structured representation (sections keyed by `¬ßn`) usable by:
- search
- excerpt composition
- citation links

# Acceptance criteria
- A parser can produce `{sectionId, title, content}` entries for all sections.
- Output is stable and deterministic.

title: Define corpus data model + anchor conventions
description:
Define:
- what constitutes a section (`¬ßn`)
- fields: id/title/body/sourceDoc
- rules for stable IDs

Done when: model is written and won‚Äôt change every week.

title: Implement transcript parser + validation
description:
Implement parsing of `complete_brenner_transcript.md` into structured sections.

Done when: parser output count matches expected and section IDs are stable.

title: Add build-time generated corpus index (documented generator)
description:
Create a generator step that outputs a `generated/` index (if needed for performance) and document the command.

Done when: the repo has a clear generator story and no hand-edits of generated outputs.

title: Corpus: fast full-text search (sections + snippets + anchors)
description:
# Goal
Provide fast search across:
- transcript sections
- distillations
- quote bank

Results must preserve provenance:
- which doc
- which section anchor (`¬ßn` where applicable)
- snippet

# Acceptance criteria
- Search API returns ranked hits with stable anchors.
- UX supports an "excerpt builder" workflow.

title: Choose search approach (runtime scan vs prebuilt index)
description:
Decide based on constraints:
- corpus size
- Vercel execution constraints
- cold start

Done when: we pick an approach and document tradeoffs.

title: Implement search API (ranked hits + snippets + anchors)
description:
Implement a search function usable by web + CLI.

Done when: query returns doc/anchor/snippet and is fast enough for interactive UX.

title: Add snippet highlighting + filters (doc/operator/tag)
description:
Enhance search results:
- highlight matched terms
- filter by doc type and (later) operator tags

Done when: search supports the excerpt workflow efficiently.

title: Quote bank: normalize primitives + operator tags
description:
# Goal
Make `quote_bank_restored_primitives.md` computationally usable:
- parse into structured entries keyed by `¬ßn`
- tag by operator(s), concept(s), failure modes

# Acceptance criteria
- Each quote maps to at least one operator.
- Quote entries are searchable/filterable.

title: Define quote tag taxonomy (operators, motifs, primitives)
description:
Define a small, stable tag set:
- operator tags (‚äò, ùìõ, etc.)
- motif tags ("third alternative", "digital handle", etc.)

Done when: taxonomy is compact and usable in UI.

title: Parse quote bank into structured entries
description:
Parse `quote_bank_restored_primitives.md` into a structured representation keyed by `¬ßn`.

Done when: every entry has `sectionId`, `quote`, `context`, and tags field.

title: Tag quotes by operator + coverage audit
description:
Apply tags and audit coverage:
- each operator has at least one quote
- flag missing operators/weak coverage

Done when: tags are usable for operator navigation.

title: Excerpt builder: compose cited excerpts for prompts
description:
# Goal
Make it trivial to create a high-quality excerpt block for a session kickoff:
- pick sections/quotes
- auto-include citations (`¬ßn`)
- keep excerpt short but information-dense

# Acceptance criteria
- Web UI and CLI can both produce an excerpt block.
- Excerpt includes citations and doc references.

title: Web: excerpt picker UI integrated with corpus
description:
Add UI that lets users:
- search corpus
- select sections/quotes
- compile a cited excerpt block

Done when: excerpt is one click away from kickoff.

title: CLI: excerpt compose from section IDs / tags
description:
Add CLI command(s) to build an excerpt from:
- list of `¬ßn`
- tag filters

Done when: CLI can produce the same excerpt format as the web.

title: Align excerpt format with artifact/protocol schema
description:
Ensure excerpt blocks:
- preserve citations
- have consistent heading format
- are compatible with kickoff templates

Done when: kickoff prompt composition is frictionless.

title: EPIC: Agent Orchestration Layer (Agent Mail + artifact compiler)
description:
# Goal
Implement the multi-agent loop as an **orchestrator**:
- send role-specific prompts via Agent Mail
- track thread state and acknowledgements
- parse structured responses
- compile/merge into canonical artifacts

# Why this matters
The orchestrator is the bridge between protocol (what we want) and execution (agents producing outputs).

title: Agent Mail: integration hardening (client + contracts + errors)
description:
# Goal
Make Agent Mail integration robust and shared across web + CLI.

Scope:
- standardize client behavior (URL/path/token)
- document which MCP tools/resources we depend on
- handle non-JSON/SSE responses gracefully
- improve error messages (operator-friendly)

title: Agent Mail: document tool/resource contracts we rely on
description:
Inventory Agent Mail MCP methods/resources we use:
- ensure_project
- register_agent
- send_message
- resources like `resource://agents/...`

Done when: we have a written contract + fallback behavior when unavailable.

title: Unify AgentMailClient between web + CLI
description:
Currently we have near-duplicate clients in `brenner.ts` and `apps/web/src/lib/agentMail.ts`.

Done when: one canonical implementation exists and both callers use it.

title: Safety gate: disable orchestration by default in public deployments
description:
Public deployments must not allow arbitrary users to trigger Agent Mail operations.

Define gating strategy:
- environment variable (e.g., `LAB_MODE=1`)
- app-layer auth (secret / Cloudflare Access)
- hard fail closed when not enabled

Done when: orchestration routes/actions are unreachable without explicit enablement.

title: Session runner: kickoff multi-agent Brenner Loop
description:
# Goal
One command/click should:
- ensure project
- register sender agent identity
- send role-specific kickoff prompts to recipients
- optionally require ack

This is the execution engine for the protocol kernel.

title: Implement kickoff sending with role prompts + excerpt
description:
Implement the session kickoff primitive:
- choose templates per role
- compose prompt body (template + excerpt + optional theme/domain/question)
- send to recipients via Agent Mail

Done when: one command/click can start a session deterministically.

title: Add session rounds (critique/iterate on compiled artifact)
description:
Define and implement follow-up rounds:
- round 0: kickoff
- round 1: compile artifact
- round 2: send artifact back for critique / missing operators

Done when: the protocol supports iteration without chaos.

title: Thread state: fetch messages + ack tracking + status
description:
# Goal
Provide deterministic visibility into a session:
- which agents responded
- unread counts / pending acks
- latest compiled artifact pointer

title: CLI: fetch inbox + thread messages + quick summary
description:
Add CLI commands to:
- list unread threads
- fetch a thread‚Äôs messages
- summarize which agents responded

Done when: CLI is usable for monitoring sessions.

title: Compute thread/session status (responses, acks, latest artifact)
description:
Implement a status computation step that:
- detects role completion
- tracks pending acks
- points to latest compiled artifact message

Done when: both web + CLI can show the same status.

title: Detect and extract structured delta blocks from messages
description:
Implement parsing utilities to find the structured delta payload inside agent messages.

Done when: compiler can operate without heuristics for every model.

title: Artifact compiler: parse deltas ‚Üí merge ‚Üí render
description:
# Goal
Turn multiple agent responses into one canonical artifact:
- parse structured deltas
- merge deterministically
- render canonical markdown

Key constraint: outputs must stay auditable (keep citations).

title: Implement delta parser for chosen format
description:
Implement parsing for the delta format chosen in `Prompt pack`.

Done when: parsed deltas can be merged and validated.

title: Implement artifact merge algorithm + conflict policy
description:
Implement deterministic merge rules (from artifact schema spec).

Done when: merging two agent deltas yields predictable output.

title: Render canonical artifact markdown + run linter
description:
Implement rendering of merged artifact into canonical markdown and run guardrail checks.

Done when: output artifact is human-readable and machine-checkable.

title: Persistence: store artifacts + publish compiled updates
description:
# Goal
Persist session results durably with minimal file sprawl.

Decide:
- repo layout for sessions
- whether compilation writes to repo automatically or via explicit operator command
- how compiled artifacts are posted back to Agent Mail

title: Decide minimal session artifact storage layout
description:
Decide where session artifacts live in the repo (minimize file sprawl).

Candidate: `sessions/<threadId>.md` plus an optional index.

Done when: layout is chosen and documented.

title: Implement explicit command to write artifact to repo
description:
Implement an explicit operator-triggered write step (avoid surprise writes):
- write compiled artifact to chosen location
- update any index

Done when: artifacts can become durable repo objects.

title: Publish compiled artifact back to Agent Mail thread
description:
Post the compiled artifact into the session thread using the thread protocol.

Done when: the thread contains a canonical compiled artifact message.

title: EPIC: Web App (brennerbot.org)
description:
# Goal
Ship a web app that feels like a **scientific IDE**:
- corpus browse + search + excerpt picker
- session UI (kickoff ‚Üí responses ‚Üí compiled artifacts)
- safe public mode + gated lab mode

# Why this matters
The web app is the "front door" for humans; it must make Brenner moves easy to execute and hard to fake.

title: Web: corpus reader UX (markdown render + TOC + anchors)
description:
# Goal
Make reading the corpus pleasant and *citable*:
- render markdown nicely (not raw `<pre>`)
- table of contents
- stable anchor links (esp. `¬ßn`)
- copy citation/excerpt utilities

title: Render corpus docs as markdown (typography, code, links)
description:
Replace raw `<pre>` rendering with a safe markdown renderer.

Done when: corpus pages are readable and preserve formatting.

title: Add TOC + stable anchors (esp. ¬ßn)
description:
Add table of contents and stable anchor links.

Done when: users can deep-link and cite sections reliably.

title: Add copy actions (citation, excerpt snippet)
description:
Add small UX helpers:
- copy a citation for current section
- copy a selected excerpt with ¬ß anchors

Done when: excerpt building is faster.

title: Web: corpus search + excerpt builder
description:
# Goal
Interactive search that flows into excerpt building:
- search results ‚Üí select ‚Üí excerpt block
- preserve citations and doc anchors

This is the web-facing UX counterpart of the corpus engine.

title: Build search UI (query, results, filters)
description:
Implement search UI integrated with the corpus engine.

Done when: results show snippet + anchor and are fast.

title: Build excerpt builder component
description:
Component that:
- accumulates selected hits/sections
- outputs a cited excerpt block

Done when: excerpt can be exported to session kickoff.

title: Wire excerpt builder ‚Üí New Session prefill
description:
Allow `/sessions/new` to accept a prefilled excerpt (via query param or state).

Done when: corpus ‚Üí session kickoff is one smooth flow.

title: Web: sessions UI (create/list/detail + artifact panel)
description:
# Goal
A session page should show:
- current research thread
- agent responses timeline
- compiled artifact (live-updating as responses arrive)
- next-step buttons (compile, request critique round, etc.)

title: Add session detail route (thread timeline + artifact panel)
description:
Create `/sessions/[threadId]` page showing:
- messages timeline
- parsed deltas
- compiled artifact

Done when: users can monitor a live session.

title: Implement refresh/polling strategy for thread updates
description:
Decide how the UI updates as messages arrive:
- manual refresh vs polling vs SSE

Done when: UX feels responsive without complexity.

title: Add session actions (compile, request critique round, publish)
description:
Add buttons to trigger orchestrator actions (lab mode only).

Done when: session iteration is possible from UI.

title: Web: lab mode auth + gating (protect Agent Mail actions)
description:
# Goal
Public site must not allow orchestration side-effects.

Implement gating for:
- session kickoff send
- thread fetch actions (if sensitive)
- any artifact persistence

Preferred: Cloudflare Access and/or app-layer shared secret.

title: Define threat model + choose auth mechanism
description:
Define:
- who should access lab mode
- what endpoints are dangerous
- preferred gating (Cloudflare Access vs app secret vs both)

Done when: a clear security model exists.

title: Enforce auth + lab mode gating on server actions
description:
Implement hard fail-closed checks around:
- sending messages
- reading sensitive data

Done when: public users cannot trigger orchestration.

title: UX for locked/unlocked lab mode
description:
Add UI cues when lab mode is locked:
- show why
- show how to unlock (operator instructions)

Done when: operators aren‚Äôt confused.

title: Web: operator palette + prompt builder UI
description:
# Goal
Make Brenner moves tangible in the UI:
- show operator palette with definitions + quotes
- let user apply operators to a question
- generate role-specific prompt bundles

This is how we turn the distillations into an executable interface.

title: Create operator data source for UI (from operator library spec)
description:
Define how web app loads operator definitions + quotes.

Done when: operator palette is data-driven, not hard-coded.

title: Build operator palette UI (definitions + anchored quotes)
description:
Render operator cards with:
- definition
- when-to-use
- key quotes (`¬ßn`)

Done when: operators are explorable and citable.

title: Prompt builder UI (operator selection ‚Üí role prompt bundle)
description:
Let users select operators and generate:
- kickoff prompt
- role-specific prompts

Done when: protocol is executable from UI.

title: EPIC: CLI/Binary (brenner)
description:
# Goal
Turn `brenner.ts` into a **single executable** that can:
- run sessions end-to-end (compose ‚Üí send ‚Üí fetch ‚Üí compile)
- integrate with Agent Mail (threads, inbox, ack)
- optionally integrate memory (`cm`) for context augmentation

# Why this matters
The CLI is how we automate and how power users operate without UI friction.

title: CLI: command surface + config
description:
# Goal
Make the CLI a coherent tool (not a pile of subcommands):
- consistent command naming
- readable `--help`
- config defaults (project key, Agent Mail URL, preferred templates)

Constraint: Bun-only, and should compile to a single executable.

title: Define CLI command map + config precedence
description:
Define the CLI surface area:
- commands and subcommands
- required flags
- config precedence (flags > env > config file > defaults)

Done when: we have a stable contract for users.

title: Implement config loader (env + config file)
description:
Implement a config loader that supports:
- Agent Mail URL/path/token
- default project key
- default templates

Done when: users stop needing to pass repetitive flags.

title: Improve CLI help output + examples
description:
Make `--help` a good experience.

Done when: examples cover the main workflows end-to-end.

title: CLI: Agent Mail inbox/thread tooling
description:
# Goal
Make it easy to operate sessions from terminal:
- list agents
- list unread threads
- view thread messages
- ack messages

title: CLI: list agents / agent directory
description:
Implement `mail agents` (or equivalent) and show:
- agent names
- unread counts (if available)

title: CLI: inbox + thread view + ack
description:
Implement:
- list inbox/unread threads
- view a thread
- ack messages when required

title: CLI: thread summary (who responded, latest artifact)
description:
Add a quick summary command for sessions.

Done when: operators can see session state at a glance.

title: CLI: sessions (start/status/fetch/compile/publish)
description:
# Goal
Expose the orchestration layer as CLI commands:
- `session start` (role kickoffs)
- `session status` (responses/acks)
- `session compile` (merge deltas ‚Üí artifact)
- `session publish` (post compiled artifact)

title: CLI: session start (role kickoffs)
description:
Implement `session start` using:
- protocol templates
- excerpt builder
- role prompt pack

Done when: CLI starts sessions reliably.

title: CLI: session status / wait until complete
description: Implement `session status` and an optional `--watch` / polling mode.

title: CLI: session compile + publish commands
description:
Implement:
- `session compile` (merge deltas ‚Üí artifact)
- `session publish` (post compiled artifact)
- optional `session write` (persist artifact to repo)

title: CLI: corpus tools (search/read/excerpt)
description:
# Goal
Enable corpus-first workflows without the web app:
- `corpus search`
- `corpus read --doc ...`
- `excerpt build --sections ...`

title: CLI: corpus search command
description: Implement `corpus search` using the shared search engine.

title: CLI: excerpt builder command
description: Implement `excerpt build` that outputs a cited excerpt block.

title: CLI: single-binary build + release workflow
description:
# Goal
Ship a compiled binary via `bun build --compile`.

Define:
- build command(s)
- output naming
- minimal release notes procedure

title: Add bun compile build script + verify binary
description: Add build instructions and verify the compiled binary runs for the main commands.

title: Document install/update workflow for the binary
description:
Write minimal docs for:
- building locally
- distributing internally

Done when: future-self can reproduce the binary.

title: EPIC: Memory Integration (cass-memory / cm)
description:
# Goal
Integrate the cass memory system so sessions can:
- retrieve relevant procedural rules + past insights
- augment kickoffs with retrieved context
- (later) feed durable artifacts back into memory

# Why this matters
Brenner-style work compounds. Memory prevents re-deriving the same primitives and enables cumulative research.

title: Memory: cass-memory discovery + integration design
description:
# Goal
Understand cass-memory (`cm`) well enough to integrate responsibly.

We need:
- what data it can return (rules, snippets, suggested queries)
- command/API surface
- performance characteristics
- how to avoid coupling the web app to a local-only tool

title: Read cass_memory_system docs + record integration notes
description:
Read the cass-memory docs/repo and capture:
- primary CLI commands (`cm context`, etc.)
- output schema fields
- best practices (hygiene, pitfalls)

Done when: we can call it reliably from a program.

title: Decide integration boundary (local-only vs hosted)
description:
Decide what runs where:
- CLI: local `cm` integration is fine
- Web (Vercel): cannot assume `cm` exists

Define a plan for hosted memory (future) without blocking v1.

title: Design memory injection format for kickoffs
description:
Define how memory context is included in prompts:
- short bullets
- explicit provenance ("from memory")
- avoid over-conditioning agents

title: Memory: CLI integration (augment kickoffs with cm context)
description:
# Goal
Allow `brenner session start` to optionally:
- run `cm context "<question>" --json`
- inject relevant bullets into the kickoff prompt
- record what was injected for auditability

title: Implement brenner memory context wrapper
description:
Implement a CLI wrapper around:
- `cm context "..." --json`

Done when: we can get structured memory results programmatically.

title: Integrate memory context into session start (optional flag)
description:
Add a flag (e.g., `--with-memory`) to:
- run `cm context`
- inject relevant bullets into kickoff

Done when: memory is opt-in and doesn‚Äôt break sessions if unavailable.

title: Add audit trail: record injected memory in the kickoff artifact
description:
Ensure prompts/artifacts record what memory context was used.

Done when: we can audit why a session went a certain way.

title: Memory: feedback loop (session artifacts ‚Üí durable memory)
description:
# Goal
Over time, artifacts should feed back into memory so we compound.

This is a later-stage feature; design carefully to avoid garbage-in.

title: Define what gets written back to memory (hygiene rules)
description:
Define rules for updating memory from artifacts:
- what qualifies as a rule
- how to avoid storing hallucinated ‚Äúfacts‚Äù
- human review requirements

title: Prototype exporting session artifacts to memory-friendly format
description:
Prototype a command that turns a compiled artifact into:
- a small set of stable lessons / procedural rules

Done when: output is reviewable and low-noise.

title: EPIC: Deployment & Ops (Cloudflare + Vercel)
description:
# Goal
Deploy the web app to Vercel and serve at `brennerbot.org` (Cloudflare-managed).

Key constraints:
- public site safe by default
- lab/orchestration actions gated (Cloudflare Access and/or app-layer auth)
- minimal operational complexity

title: Deploy: Vercel project setup (apps/web)
description:
# Goal
Deploy `apps/web` to Vercel with Bun tooling.

Scope:
- project initialization
- build/install commands
- env var wiring
- preview deployments

title: Vercel: initialize project + configure Bun build
description:
Use `vercel` CLI to:
- create/link project for `apps/web`
- configure install/build commands to use Bun

Done when: a preview deploy builds successfully.

title: Vercel: set environment variables + secrets
description:
Set env vars for:
- public mode vs lab mode
- Agent Mail base URL/path/token (lab only)

Done when: prod deploy is safe-by-default.

title: Vercel: configure preview deployments / branch strategy
description:
Define which branches deploy where.

Done when: PRs get preview URLs automatically.

title: Deploy: Cloudflare DNS + domain config (brennerbot.org)
description:
# Goal
Serve the web app at `brennerbot.org` (Cloudflare-managed).

Scope:
- apex + www routing
- SSL
- redirects

title: Cloudflare: configure DNS for apex + www to Vercel
description:
Configure:
- `brennerbot.org`
- `www.brennerbot.org`

Done when: HTTPS works and domain resolves to Vercel.

title: Cloudflare: redirects + TLS settings
description:
Configure:
- redirect www ‚Üí apex (or chosen canonical)
- enforce HTTPS

Done when: URLs are consistent.

title: Security: protect lab mode (Cloudflare Access + app gating)
description:
# Goal
Ensure only authorized operators can trigger orchestration.

Scope:
- Cloudflare Access policy (preferred)
- app-layer fallback secret
- ensure fail-closed

title: Cloudflare Access: define policy for lab mode
description:
Define Access policy (who can access lab endpoints).

Done when: lab routes are protected in production.

title: App-layer gating fallback (shared secret)
description:
Implement an app-layer fallback that:
- checks a secret header/cookie
- fails closed

Done when: even without Access, orchestration is protected.

title: CI: quality gates (build/lint/type-check)
description:
# Goal
Automate quality gates for the web app and CLI.

Minimum:
- `bun run build` (apps/web)
- `bun run lint` (apps/web)

title: CI: add workflow for apps/web build + lint
description:
Add GitHub Actions that run:
- `cd apps/web && bun install && bun run build && bun run lint`

Done when: PRs are gated by build health.

title: CI: add basic checks for CLI (bun run / typecheck)
description: Add lightweight checks for the CLI (as it evolves).

title: Optional: Cloudflare Worker (wrangler) for routing/gateway
description:
# Goal
Decide whether we want a Worker in front of Vercel for:
- advanced routing
- caching
- potential secure gateway patterns

Not required for v1 unless it unlocks something specific.

title: Wrangler: evaluate Worker use-cases (go/no-go)
description:
Decide if a Worker meaningfully helps (routing, caching, gateway patterns).

Done when: we have a clear decision with reasoning.

title: Wrangler: implement + deploy Worker (if chosen)
description: Only if `go`.

title: Content policy: transcript rights + public vs private mode
description:
# Goal
Before putting the full transcript corpus on `brennerbot.org`, verify terms and decide what is publicly served.

Why:
- transcripts may have redistribution constraints
- the public site should be legally and ethically clean

Outputs:
- a clear policy: what is public, what is gated, what is never served

title: Verify transcript source terms (Web of Stories) + implications
description:
Verify:
- whether we can host full transcripts publicly
- attribution requirements
- any restrictions

Done when: we have an explicit go/no-go decision.

title: Add attribution/terms page to web app
description:
Add a page that:
- attributes transcript source
- states terms/disclaimers

Done when: public site has clear provenance.

title: Implement content gating (public doc allowlist)
description:
Implement a public allowlist so we can:
- serve only permitted docs in public mode
- require auth for restricted docs

title: EPIC: Evaluation & Quality Gates
description:
# Goal
Make output quality measurable and regressions detectable:
- artifact linting rules (structure + Brenner guardrails)
- golden sessions / fixtures
- automated build/lint/type-check gates
- onboarding docs + runbooks

title: Quality: implement artifact linter + scorecard
description:
# Goal
Implement the linter defined in the protocol kernel so we can:
- detect drift (missing third alternative, missing potency checks, etc.)
- provide a "Brenner-ness" scorecard

This makes quality measurable.

title: Implement linter core rules + severity levels
description:
Implement the linter spec (from Protocol Kernel).

Done when: linter produces actionable errors/warnings on a compiled artifact.

title: Add CLI lint command + compiler integration
description:
Expose linting:
- `brenner lint <artifact>`
- compiler runs linter automatically and prints results

title: Show linter results in web session UI
description: Display linter output next to compiled artifact.

title: Quality: golden sessions + regression harness
description:
# Goal
Create a small set of golden session artifacts and a harness that ensures:
- schemas remain compatible
- compiler outputs are stable
- linter rules don‚Äôt regress

title: Create golden artifacts + expected linter output
description: Capture 1‚Äì3 goldens (small but representative).

title: Add regression harness for compiler/linter
description:
Add a command that runs:
- compile on fixture inputs
- lints output
- compares against expected

title: Docs: operator playbook + runbooks
description:
# Goal
Write operator-friendly docs:
- how to run Agent Mail
- how to start/monitor/compile sessions
- how to deploy the web app
- how to build the CLI binary

title: Runbook: local lab setup (Agent Mail + env)
description:
Document how to:
- run Agent Mail server
- configure env vars
- start a session

title: Runbook: deployment (Vercel + Cloudflare)
description:
Document:
- Vercel project setup
- Cloudflare DNS
- access control

title: Runbook: CLI workflows
description:
Document:
- session start/status/compile/publish
- corpus search/excerpt

title: Web: add corpus search + excerpt picker
description: Add full-text search over transcript/distillations and a UI to select excerpt chunks to inject into Brenner Loop prompts.
close_reason: Superseded by brenner_bot-5so.4.2 (Web search + excerpt builder)

title: Orchestration: role-specific Brenner Loop templates + artifacts
description: Define role-specific prompt variants (Codex/Claude/Gemini) and produce durable artifacts (hypothesis slate, discriminative tests, assumption ledger) with storage back into the repo.

title: Docs: incorporate high-signal primitives from transcripts 75‚Äì113
description: Extend quote bank with verbatim primitives from transcripts 75‚Äì113 (hurricane/desert risk management, DIY scaling, negative staining democratization, decisive mRNA/ribosome experiments, quick de-risking pilots, Mg2+/Cs+ dominant-variable rescue, frameshift/topology). Then propagate into metaprompt + distillation docs, guided by gpt_pro_extended_reasoning_responses/brenner_bot__gpt_pro_52__response_previously_truncated_batch.md.

title: Docs: incorporate new verbatim transcript primitives
description: Extract quote bank (keyed by ¬ß) from newly un-truncated transcripts and update metaprompt + distillation docs to reflect the new primitives.

title: CLI: add inbox fetch + thread summary helpers
description: Extend brenner.ts with Agent Mail helpers: fetch inbox, read thread, summarize thread, ack messages, and basic polling.

title: Quote bank: normalize operator mapping + tags
description: Normalize quote bank into operator-keyed mapping (‚äò/ùìõ/‚ßâ/‚â°/‚úÇ/‚üÇ/‚Üë/‚áì/ŒîE/‚àø/‚äô) with a canonical tag taxonomy; keep file sprawl minimal and ensure every operator has ‚â•3 grounded quotes.
